answers.answer: Yep, they'll keep monitoring it if you bp is still raised or you have other symptoms of hypertension or preeclamplsia.
In how many weeks do they start soing that test?
They don't do the test unless protein is found in your urine ^

I had high blood pressure at 35 weeks now at 37 weeks I have high blood pressure, headaches, and they said they found a very very tiny amount of protein in my pee. I have never know anyone to take that test more then once.

I had preeclamplsia from 28wks and they tested my urine every drs visit every week. My protein was high enough to not have to do the 24hr test so I'd say your at risk but managing it well so far whichnis fantastic. Hang in there!

Apparently I am really at handling all of the stuff going on with me. My blood pressure I am able to relax enough to get it down only when I go into labor and delivery so I dont have to take medicine, I have done my best with my gestational diabetes so I dont have to take anything for that and I just take a nap if I dont feel good and I wake up refreshed. I dont know about this protein thing.

They normally do the urine test when protein is found to make sure your kidney n liver are ok too. They must have found something in your urine work to make you retest. They only had me do it once and everything was normal. They probably testing for preclamsta
They checked the first time cause of swelling and high blood pressure. This time they didnt tell me why they just said take this home and fill it with pee and bring it back tomorrow.

question: Has anyone else had to that the 24 hour pee test to see if they were leaking protein. I took it like 2 weeks ago but now they are making me do it again. Is that normal for someone to take that test more then once?
title: I am confused.
